pages.text: There are two docking rails: locomotive and train car. A Locomotive docking rail must always be present in any setup, and train car docs need to be lined up in a straight line after. These rails do not transfer themselves but communicate to the locomotive whether there's stuff to transfer and it needs to wait.  Alternatively, the locomotive can be forced to wait by applying a redstone signal.

pages.title: Locomotive Docking rail
pages.text: The locomotive dock can only insert into the tug (orange/output mode), place a hopper besides the rail to insert. Must be facing in the same direction as locomotive movement. See the next page for train car dock >>>

pages.title: Train Car Docking Rail
pages.text: The train docking can both facilitate output (orange mode) and input (blue mode) to/from the barges, shift-right click to switch the mode. Place a hopper underneath the rail to extract resources.
